MajorClaims.MC1: there are many things in the past that we can learn about, such as mistakes, success and knowledge in many fields of study
MajorClaims.MC2: the past's mistakes, success and knowledge all have crucial impact on people's lives today

Claims.C2: past obviously saves ourselves a bunch of failures and times
Claims.C3: people's success in the past is as significant as those mistakes
Claims.C4: the past is the basis in which people can use to develope new knowledge, inventions

Premises.P1: As everyone's life is too short to risk trying anything without any prepare, we all should learn about other's mistakes
Premises.P2: we can avoid making the same ones
Premises.P3: Each mistake, from the smallest to the bigger one, is a treasure of experience, which, if we can make full use of, will make us well-prepared for many complicated situations of our life
Premises.P4: the predecessors' mistakes are the first thing that we should consider when learning about the past
Premises.P5: others' accomplishment can be served as the direct way
Premises.P6: If the predecessors' mistakes are the indirect way that leads us to the goals
Premises.P7: By looking into the ways other people use to achieve their targets, we have the chance to make those mine, put them into practice and, of course, be successful like them
Premises.P8: Edison's statement "Genius is 1 percent inspiration and 99 percent perspiration" is still helpful for everyone today, and probably in the future
Premises.P9: If it had not been for those knowledge in the past, we could never be as modern as today
Premises.P10: How can America be the world's leading country if Columbus did not accidentally discover it in his search for India
Premises.P11: How can the comtemporary scientists study the earth's gravity without the apple which fall on Newton's head
Premises.P12: They are only some of many precious knowledge that the past presents us
Premises.P13: We cannot ignore them in any way
